byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

abstract: Denmark passes law requiring newly arrived asylum seekers to turn over valuables as way to contribute toward costs of their stay in country, stirring debate.

headline.print_headline: Denmark to Confiscate Asylum Seekers’ Valuables
headline.main: Danish Law Requires Asylum Seekers to Hand Over Valuables

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Migrants with assets above about $1,450 must now help pay for their stay. Goods with sentimental value like wedding rings are exempt from seizure.
lead_paragraph: Migrants with assets above about $1,450 must now help pay for their stay. Goods with sentimental value like wedding rings are exempt from seizure.
